action.action-desc: Mr. Curtis introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of Energy to make awards to cover regulatory costs relating to licensing certain first-of-a-kind advanced nuclear reactors.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Advanced Nuclear Reactor Prize Act.
Section 103 of the Nuclear Energy Innovation and Modernization Act (Public Law 115–439; 132 Stat. 5571) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Prize for advanced nuclear reactor licensing

paragraph.header: Prize for advanced nuclear reactor licensing

subparagraph.text: Subject to the availability of appropriations, the Secretary may make, with respect to each award category described in subparagraph (C), an award in the amount described in subparagraph (B) to the first non-Federal entity to which the Commission issues—

clause.text: an operating license for an advanced nuclear reactor under part 50 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation), for which a license has not been issued by the Commission as of the date of enactment of this subsection; or
a finding required under section 52.103(g) of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation), with respect to a combined license for an advanced nuclear reactor—

subclause.text: that is issued under subpart C of part 52 of such title (or any successor regulation); and
for which a license has not been issued by the Commission as of the date of enactment of this subsection.

subparagraph.text: Except as provided in paragraph (2), an award made under subparagraph (A) shall be equal to the total amount assessed by the Commission and collected under section 102(b)(2) from the entity receiving the award for costs relating to the issuance of the license described in that subparagraph, including, as applicable, costs relating to the issuance of an associated construction permit (as described in section 50.23 of title 10, Code of Federal Regulations (or any successor regulation)) or early site permit (as defined in section 52.1 of that title (or any successor regulation)).
The award categories described in this subparagraph are the following:

clause.text: The first advanced nuclear reactor for which the Commission issues—

subclause.text: a license in accordance with clause (i) of subparagraph (A); or
a finding in accordance with clause (ii) of that subparagraph.
uses isotopes derived from spent nuclear fuel (as defined in section 2 of the Nuclear Waste Policy Act of 1982 (42 U.S.C. 10101)) or depleted uranium as fuel for the advanced nuclear reactor; and
is the first advanced nuclear reactor described in subclause (I) for which the Commission issues—

item.text: a license in accordance with clause (i) of subparagraph (A); or
a finding in accordance with clause (ii) of that subparagraph.

subclause.text: operates to generate electricity or high temperature process heat for nonelectric applications; and
is the first advanced nuclear reactor described in subclause (I) for which the Commission issues—

item.text: a license in accordance with clause (i) of subparagraph (A); or
a finding in accordance with clause (ii) of that subparagraph.

paragraph.text: An award made under this subsection may not exceed the amount that is equal to—

subparagraph.text: the total amount expended by the non-Federal entity with respect to licensing costs relating to the license for which the award is made; less
the amount that is equal to—

clause.text: any expenditures made with Federal funds for the applicable project; plus
the minimum cost-share required under section 988 of the Energy Policy Act of 2005 (42 U.S.C. 16352).
